isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, AND 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - SPLASH PANELS

step1.para: To remove the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 20) on the 9200 Model, use the following procedure.

step2.para: With the hood tilted open, drill out the rivets (Item 1, Figure 20) attaching the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 20) to the hood/fender assembly (Item 3, Figure 20), driver side shown.
Tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies.

Remove cotter pin (Item 9, Figure 21) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 8, Figure 21) and pull out retaining pin (Item 9, Figure 21) securing tilt assist spring assembly (Item 10, Figure 21) to the tilt assist spring bracket, driver side shown.

Remove 3 hex bolts, flat washers, lockwashers and hex nuts (Item 4, Figure 20) from the front of the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 20), then remove the 4 hex bolts, lockwashers and hex nuts (Item 7, Figure 21) and remove the spring assembly bracket (Item 8, Figure 21) at the rear of the splash panel. Then remove the splash panel, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove the passenger side splash panel.

step1.para: To remove the hood/fender splash panel (Item 2, Figure 22) on the 9400 Model, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove the hex bolt and hex crown lock nut (Item 1, Figure 21) from the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 2, Figure 21) and remove the shock absorber (Item 3, Figure 21), driver side only.

Remove 2 bolts, lockwashers, flat washers, and nuts (Item 4, Figure 21) from the hood shock absorber bracket and hood/splash panel support (Item 5, Figure 21) and remove the hood shock absorber bracket, driver side only.

Drill out the rivets (Item 1, Figure 22) attaching the hood/fender splash panel (Item 2, Figure 22) to the hood/fender assembly (Item 3, Figure 22) and remove the hood/fender splash panel, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure, except for shock absorber, to remove the passenger side hood/fender splash panel.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 22 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.
To remove the rear splash panel (Item 5) on the 9400 Model, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove the hex bolts, flat washers and lockwashers (Item 4) to remove the rear splash panel (Item 5) from both splash panel brackets (Item 6). Then remove the hex bolts, flat washers, lockwashers and hex nuts (Item 7) and reinforcement (Item 8) from the hood guide support bracket (Item 9). Remove the rear splash panel, driver side shown.
If replacing the rear splash panel (Item 5), remove the mud guard (Item 2, Figure 34) from the lower edge of the rear splash panel. Refer to MUD GUARDS, 9400 (Before July 1996) - Remove.
Repeat this procedure to remove the passenger side rear splash panel.

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. BOLT, FLAT WASHER, LOCKWASHER AND NUT (1/4-20 UNC)
4. BOLT, LOCKWASHER, FLAT WASHER AND NUT (9400 ONLY)
4. BOLT, FLAT WASHER AND LOCKWASHER (3/8-16 UNC)
7. BOLT, FLAT WASHER, LOCKWASHER AND NUT (5/16-18 UNC)

step1.para: To install the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 20) on the 9200 Model, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Position the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 20) on the hood/fender assembly (Item 3, Figure 20) and install the rivets (Item 1, Figure 20) attaching it to the hood/fender assembly, driver side shown.
Tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies.

Position the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 8, Figure 21) at the rear of the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 20) and install the 4 hex bolts, lockwashers and hex nuts (Item 7, Figure 21), then install the 3 hex bolts, flat washers, lockwashers and hex nuts (Item 4, Figure 20) at the front of the splash panel, driver side shown.

Position the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 10, Figure 21) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 8, Figure 21) and install the retaining pin (Item 9, Figure 21), then install the cotter pin (Item 9, Figure 21) securing the tilt assist spring assembly to tilt assist spring bracket, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to install the passenger side splash panel.

step1.para: To install the hood/fender splash panel (Item 2, Figure 22) on the 9400 Model, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Position the hood/fender splash panel (Item 2, Figure 22) on the hood/fender assembly (Item 3, Figure 22) and install the rivets (Item 1, Figure 22) attaching it to the hood/fender assembly, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to install the passenger side hood/fender splash panel.
Refer to Figure 21 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

Position the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 2) on the inside of the hood/fender splash panel (Item 6) and install the 2 mounting bolts (Item 4) through the hood shock absorber bracket, hood/fender splash panel and hood/splash panel support (Item 5) and install the 2 lockwashers, flat washers and nuts (Item 4), driver side only. Tighten to 215 to 265 in-lbs. (24 to 30 Nm).

Position the shock absorber (Item 3) into the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 2) and install the hex bolt and hex crown lock nut (Item 1) with the nut outside the hood/fender splash panel (Item 6), driver side only. Tighten nut fully down on bolt to engage nylon patch.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 22for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.
To install the rear splash panel (Item 5) on the 9400 Model, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Position the rear splash panel (Item 5) at both splash panel brackets (Item 6) and install bolts, flat washers and lockwashers (Item 4), then position the rear splash panel and reinforcement (Item 8) at the hood guide support bracket (Item 9) and install the bolts, washers and nuts, driver side shown.
If replacing rear splash panel (Item 5), install the mud guard (Item 2, Figure 34) on the lower edge of the rear splash panel. Refer to MUD GUARDS, 9400 (Before July 1996) - Install.
Repeat this procedure to install the passenger side rear splash panel.

step1.para: Release hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies.
Refer to Figure 12 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

Remove the cotter pin (Item 1) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 4) and pull out the retaining pin (Item 2) that secures the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 3) to the tilt assist spring bracket and remove tilt assist spring assembly, passenger side shown.
Remove the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 3) from the hood tilt assist spring bracket (Item 5), passenger side shown.
Refer to Figure 23 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

Remove the 2 mounting bolts (Item 1) securing the hood tilt assist spring bracket (Item 7) to the splash panel (Item 4) and hood/fender assembly (Item 2) and remove the hood tilt assist spring bracket, driver side shown.
Remove 7 hex head bolts (Item 3) attaching splash panel (Item 4) to hood/fender assembly (Item 2) and remove the splash panel, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove the passenger side hood/fender assembly splash panel.

svcsubproc.title: 9200 and 9400 (After July 1996) and 9100 (After March 1997) - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 23for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Position splash panel (Item 4) on hood/fender assembly (Item 2) and install the 7 hex head bolts (Item 3) attaching the splash panel to the hood/fender assembly, driver side shown.

Position the hood tilt assist spring bracket (Item 7) on the splash panel (Item 4) and hood/fender assembly (Item 2) and install the 2 mounting bolts (Item 1) securing it to the hood/fender assembly, driver side shown.
Tilt the hood assembly to a 45 degree angle. Support the tilted hood with a floor stand to relieve tension on the tilt assist spring assemblies.
Install the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 3, Figure 12) on the hood tilt assist spring bracket (Item 5, Figure 12), passenger side shown.

Position the tilt assist spring assembly (Item 3, Figure 12) at the tilt assist spring bracket (Item 4, Figure 12) and install the retaining pin (Item 2, Figure 12), then install the cotter pin (Item 1, Figure 12) securing the tilt assist spring assembly to the tilt assist spring bracket, passenger side shown.
Repeat this procedure to install the passenger side hood/fender assembly splash panel.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. MOUNTING BOLTS FOR TILT ASSIST SPRING ASSEMBLY MOUNTING BRACKET
6. CLEARANCE HOLE (NO MOUNTING HARDWARE TO BE INSTALLED)

svcsubproc.title: 9200 and 9400 (After July 1996) and 9100 (After March 1997) Rear Fender Extension - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 24 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: With the hood tilted open, remove the hex nut, lockwasher, flat washer and hex bolt with conical washer (Item 1) securing the rear fender extension splash panel (Item 2) to the side of the cab mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.
Remove hex bolts with conical washers (Item 4) attaching the rear fender extension splash panel (Item 2) to the under side of the cab (Item 5) and remove the splash panel, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side rear fender extension splash panel.

svcsubproc.title: 9200 and 9400 (After July 1996) and 9100 (After March 1997) Rear Fender Extension - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 24 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Position the rear fender extension splash panel (Item 2) in place on the under side of the cab (Item 5) and install the hex bolts with conical washers (Item 4) securing it to the cab, driver side shown.

Install the hex bolt with conical washer (Item 1) through the rear fender extension splash panel (Item 2) and the side of the cab mounting bracket (Item 3), then install the flat washer, lockwasher and hex nut (Item 1) securing the rear fender extension splash panel to the cab mounting bracket, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure to install passenger side rear fender extension splash panel.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. HEX BOLT WITH CONICAL WASHER, FLAT WASHER, LOCKWASHER AND HEX NUT

step1.para: To remove the front splash panel (Item 2, View A, Figure 27) on the 9300 SBA, use the following procedure.

step2.para: With the hood tilted open, remove hex bolt and hex crown lock nut (Item 1, Figure 25) and remove shock absorber (Item 2, Figure 25) from the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25), driver side only.
Remove the push-in fasteners (Item 1, Figure 26) and remove the lower insulator panel (Item 2, Figure 26), if so equipped, from the front splash panel and inner fender, driver side shown.

Remove the 2 hex bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Item 4, Figure 25) and remove the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25) and reinforcement plate (Item 6, Figure 25) from the front splash panel (Item 5, Figure 25), driver side only.
Drill out the rivets (Item 8, Figure 27) attaching the front splash panel (Item 2, View A, Figure 27) to the inner fender and remove the splash panel, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure, except for shock absorber, to remove passenger side front splash panel.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 27for all item numbers in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.
To remove the rear splash panel (Item 6, View B) on the 9300 SBA, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Remove the hex bolts, flat washers and lockwashers (Item 3, View B) to remove the rear splash panel (Item 6, View B) from both splash panel brackets (Item 4, View B).
Then remove the hex bolts, flat washers, lockwashers and hex nuts (Item 9, View B) from the hood guide support bracket (Item 5, View B). Remove the rear splash panel, driver side shown.
If replacing the rear splash panel (Item 6, View B) remove the mud guard (Item 5, Figure 33) from the lower edge of the rear splash panel. Refer to MUD GUARDS, 9300 SBA and SFA - Remove.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side rear splash panel.

step1.para: To install the front splash panel (Item 2, View A, Figure 27) on the 9300 SBA use the following procedure.

step2.para: Position the front splash panel (Item 2, View A, Figure 27) on the inner fender (Item 1, View A, Figure 27) and install the rivets (Item 8, View A, Figure 27) securing it to the hood/fender assembly, driver side shown.

Position the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25) and reinforcement plate (Item 6, Figure 25) on the front splash panel (Item 5, Figure 25) and install the 2 hex bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Item 4, Figure 25) securing it to the front splash panel, driver side only. Tighten to 215 to 265 in-lbs. (24 to 30 Nm).

Position the lower insulator panel (Item 2, Figure 26), if so equipped, on the inside of the front splash panel and inner fender (Item 4, Figure 26) and install the push-in fasteners (Item 1, Figure 26), driver side shown.

Position the shock absorber (Item 2, Figure 25) in the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25) and install the hex bolt and hex crown lock nut (Item 1, Figure 25) with the nut outside the front splash panel (Item 5, Figure 25), driver side only. Tighten nut fully down on bolt to engage nylon panel.
Repeat this procedure except for shock absorber, to install passenger side front splash panel.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 27 for all item number in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.
To install the rear splash panel (Item 6, View B) on the 9300 SBA, use the following procedure

step2.para: Position the rear splash panel (Item 6, View B) at both splash panel brackets (Item 4, View B) and install the hex bolts, flat washers and lockwashers (Item 3, View B), then position it at the hood guide support bracket (Item 5, View B) and install the hex bolts, flat washers, lockwashers and hex nuts (Item 9, View B), driver side shown.
If replacing the rear splash panel (Item 6, View B), install the mud guard (Item 5, Figure 33) on the lower edge of the rear splash panel. Refer to MUD GUARDS, 9300 SBA and SFA - Install.
Repeat this procedure to install passenger side rear splash panel.

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. HEX BOLT AND HEX CROWN LOCK NUT
4. HEX BOLT, FLAT WASHER AND HEX NUT
3. BOLT, FLAT WASHER AND LOCKWASHER (3/8-16 UNC)
9. BOLT, FLAT WASHER, LOCKWASHER AND NUT (5/16-18 UNC)

step1.para: To remove the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 28) on the 9300 SFA, use the following procedure.

step2.para: With the hood tilted open, remove hex bolt and hex crown lock nut (Item 1, Figure 25) and remove shock absorber (Item 2, Figure 25) from the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25), driver side only.
Remove the push-in fasteners (Item 1, Figure 26) and remove the lower insulator panel (Item 2, Figure 26), if so equipped, from the splash panel and inner fender, driver side shown.

Remove the 2 hex bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Item 4, Figure 25) and remove the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25) and reinforcement plate (Item 6, Figure 25) from the splash panel (Item 5, Figure 25), driver side only.
Drill out the rivets (Item 1, Figure 28) attaching the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 28) and remove the splash panel, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure, except for shock absorber, to remove passenger side splash panel.

step1.para: Refer to Figure 28 for all item numbers in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.
To install the splash panel (Item 2) on the 9300 SFA, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Position the splash panel (Item 2) on the hood/fender assembly (Item 3) and install the rivets (Item 1) securing it to the hood/fender assembly, driver side shown.

Position the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25) and reinforcement plate (Item 6, Figure 25) on the splash panel (Item 5, Figure 25) and install the 2 hex bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Item 4, Figure 25) securing it to the splash panel, driver side only. Tighten to 215 to 265 in-lbs. (24 to 30 Nm).

Position the lower insulator panel (Item 2, Figure 26), if so equipped, on the inside of the splash panel and fender (Item 4, Figure 26) and install the push-in fasteners (Item 1, Figure 26), driver side shown.

Position the shock absorber (Item 2, Figure 25) in the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25) and install the hex bolt and hex crown lock nut (Item 1, Figure 25), with the nut outside the front splash panel (Item 5, Figure 25), driver side only. Tighten nut fully down on bolt to engage nylon patch.
Repeat this procedure, except for shock absorber, to install passenger side front splash panel.

step1.para: To remove the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 29) on the 9300 SFA, use the following procedure.

step2.para: With the hood tilted open, remove hex bolt and hex crown lock nut (Item 1, Figure 25) and remove shock absorber (Item 2, Figure 25) from the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25), driver side only.
Remove the push-in fasteners (Item 1, Figure 26) and remove the lower insulator panel (Item 2, Figure 26), if so equipped, from the splash panel and inner fender, driver side shown.

Remove the 2 hex bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Item 4, Figure 25) and remove the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25) and reinforcement plate (Item 6, Figure 25), from the splash panel (Item 5, Figure 25), driver side only.
Drill out the rivets (Item 1, Figure 29) attaching the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 29) and remove the splash panel, driver side shown.
Repeat this procedure, except for shock absorber, to remove passenger side splash panel.

step1.para: To install the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 29) on the 9300 SFA, use the following procedure.

step2.para: Position the splash panel (Item 2, Figure 29) on the hood/fender assembly (Item 3, Figure 29 ) and install the rivets (Item 1, Figure 29) securing it to the hood/fender assembly, driver side shown.

Position the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25) and reinforcement plate (Item 6, Figure 25) on the splash panel (Item 5, Figure 25) and install the 2 hex bolts, flat washers and hex lock nuts (Item 4, Figure 25) securing it to the splash panel, driver side only. Tighten to 215 to 265 in-lbs. (24 to 30 Nm).

Position the lower insulator panel (Item 2, Figure 26), if so equipped, on the inside of the splash panel and fender (Item 4, Figure 26) and install the push-in fasteners (Item 1, Figure 26), driver side shown.

Position the shock absorber (Item 2, Figure 25) in the hood shock absorber bracket (Item 3, Figure 25) and install the hex bolt and hex crown lock nut (Item 1, Figure 25) with the nut outside the splash panel (Item 5, Figure 25), driver side only. Tighten nut fully down on bolt to engage nylon patch.
Repeat this procedure, except for shock absorber, to install passenger side front splash panel.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SFA - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 30for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: With hood tilted open, drill out the rivets (Item 3) attaching the splash panel (Item 1) to the hood/fender assembly (Item 2) and remove the splash panel, driver side shown. Hood shown in full open position.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side splash panel.

Position the splash panel (Item 1) on the hood/fender assembly (Item 2), then install the rivets (Item 3) attaching the splash panel on the hood/fender assembly, driver side shown. Hood shown in the full open position.
Repeat this procedure to install passenger side splash panel.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) With Fiberglass Tilt Hood - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 31 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: With hood tilted open, drill out the rivets (Item 3) attaching the splash panel (Item 5) to the inside of the hood/fender assembly (Item 1), driver side shown.

Remove hex head bolts, flat washers, lockwashers and nuts (Item 2) attaching splash panel mounting bracket on the inside of hood/fender assembly (Item 1). Also remove hex head bolt, washer and nut (Item 6) from the splash panel fender brace and splash panel (Items 4 and 5) on the outside of the splash panel and remove splash panel, driver side shown. Hood shown in the full open position.
Repeat this procedure to remove passenger side splash panel.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) With Fiberglass Tilt Hood - Install
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 31 for all items in parentheses, unless otherwise stated.

step1.para: Position the splash panel (Item 5) on the inside of the hood/fender assembly (Item 1) and install the rivets (Item 3) attaching the splash panel to the hood/fender assembly, driver side down.
Install the hex head bolts, flat washers, lockwashers and nuts (Item 2) attaching the splash panel mounting bracket on the inside of the hood/fender assembly (Item 1).

Also position the splash panel fender brace (Item 4) on the outside of the splash panel (Item 5) and install the hex head bolt, washer and nut (Item 6) securing the splash panel to the splash panel fender brace, driver side shown. Hood shown in the full open position.
Repeat this procedure to install passenger side splash panel.

figure.caption: Figure 31. 5000 SBA Hood/Fender Assembly and Splash Panel

calloutgroup.callout1: 2. HEX HEAD BOLT, FLAT WASHER, LOCKWASHER, AND NUT
6. HEX HEAD BOLT, WASHER AND NUT

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) With Optional Butterfly Hood - Remove
svcsubproc.para: The splash panel and fender are removed together as an assembly. Refer to FENDERS, 5000 SBA - Remove.

svcsubproc.title: 5000 SBA (After August 1994) With Optional Butterfly Hood - Install
svcsubproc.para: The splash panel and fender are installed together as an assembly. Refer to FENDERS, 5000 SBA - Install
